properties.entry:
The comprehensive map allows the user to review the connectivity metrics associated with their network on a gateway by gateway basis. The map may also be color coded by either the gateway or the chosen metric. To start, choose the gateways and the metrics and then click the filter button to review the results.
  • Gateway(s) - Select up to five individual gateways to review on a single map.
  • Link Quality - Choose the link quality category or categories you would like to see on the map. Note that the link quality metric is measuring the communication success rate to the primary forward neighbor. This metric is also known as ETX Band or link cost.
    • Excellent - Indicates a high success rate of communications between the node and its primary forward neighbor (Link cost of 1 or 2).
    • Average - Indicates a normal success rate of communications between the node and its primary forward neighbor (Link cost = 3).
    • Below Average - Indicates a less than average rate of communications between the node and its primary forward neighbor (Link cost >= 4).
    • Evaluating - Indicates a valid link quality cannot be calculated due to the limited number of attempts by the node to communicate with its primary forward neighbor. Once a minimum of 50 attempts have been completed, a link quality will be calculated.
  • Descendant Count - Choose the descendant count range(s) you would like to see on the map.
  • Hop Count - Choose the hop count range(s) you would like to see on the map.
  • Color Code By - Select whether to color code the pins by primary forward gateway, link quality, descendant count or hop count.
A maximum of 5 gateways may be selected.
No devices were found on the map with the provided Meter Number or Device Name.
There was a problem getting the devices for the gateway(s) selected. Please see the logs for more details.
There are devices on the primary route that do not have location coordinates. A dashed line represents a device without location data exists in the route path but is not displayed.
Request to update the primary route sent. It may take several minutes for the routes on the map to be updated.
Request to update the primary route could not be sent. Please try again later.
No descendants were found for this device.
There are descendants that do not have location coordinates. This may cause the descendant count to be higher than what is shown on the map.
